page.title: 03Great Horwood School
page.content:
Great Horwood School is a Church of England (Controlled) Combined School. It caters for children between five and twelve years of age. The youngest children come mainly from the village itself or from the hamlet of Singleborough. At eight years of age children also come from the villages of Thornborough, Whaddon and Nash.
There are about 173 pupils in the school and seven teachers. The school was built in 1857, but the old building is only used as a canteen.In 1960 a new building with four classrooms was built and since then two more classrooms have been added.The school has a small swimming pool and a conservation area, which includes a pond.
